intro: Ptisana sambucina, commonly known as sweet woodruff, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fragrant, small white flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its aromatic properties make it a popular ingredient in herbal teas and traditional medicine. Ptisana sambucina is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in floral arrangements.
